required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Abatacept in the Treatment of Uveitis
clinical_study.official_title: An Openlabel, Phase II Trial of Abatacept (Orencia) in the Treatment of Refractory Non-infectious Uveitis.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of abatacept in the treatment of uveitis.

primary_outcome.description: number of participants with adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Improvement by 2 or More Lines of Best-corrected Visual Acuity
secondary_outcome.description: improvement by 2 or more lines of best-corrected visual acuity With the outcome measure being at 24 weeks, only one group is analyzed. All the subjects received open-label abatacept at 10 mg/kg during the first 24 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reduction in Systemic Corticosteroid or Other Immunosuppressive Therapy by at Least 50%
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction in dose of systemic corticosteroid or other immunosuppressive therapy by at least 50% With the outcome measure being at 24 weeks, only one group is analyzed. All the subjects received open-label abatacept at 10 mg/kg during the first 24 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Control of Ocular Inflammation, as Judged on Clinical Criteria, According to Standard Methods
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction of AC cellular activity and/or vitreous haze by 2 grades. Reduction of chorioretinal infiltrates or reduction of retinal vasculitis. Reduction of cystoid macular edema and/or retinal inflammation. With the outcome measure being at 24 weeks, only one group is analyzed. All the subjects received open-label abatacept at 10 mg/kg during the first 24 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: open-label abatacept first, then 5 mg/kg abatacept
arm_group.description: 10 mg/kg abatacept (6 months). Then 5 mg/kg abatacept (18 months)

arm_group.arm_group_label: open-label abatacept first, then 10 mg/kg abatacept
arm_group.description: 10 mg/kg abatacept (6 months). Then 10 mg/kg abatacept (18 months)

intervention.description: Subjects will receive approximately 10 mg/kg rounded to the nearest 25 mg for the first 6 months of the trial. At 6 months subjects will then be randomized to receive either 5 mg/kg or 10 mg/kg. Abatacept will be administered as a 30-minute intravenous infusion. Following the initial administration, abatacept will be given at 2 and 4 weeks after the first infusion and every 4 weeks thereafter for up to 2 years.
intervention.arm_group_label: open-label abatacept first, then 10 mg/kg abatacept
open-label abatacept first, then 5 mg/kg abatacept

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with vision-threatening autoimmune uveitis
- failure to respond to prednisone and at least one other systemic immunosuppressive, or intolerance to such medications due to side effects
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious concomitant illness that could interfere with the subject's participation

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Open-label Abatacept, Then 10 mg/kg Abatacept
group.description: Abatacept: Subjects will receive approximately 10 mg/kg rounded to the nearest 25 mg for the first 6 months of the trial. At 6 months subjects will then 10 mg/kg. Abatacept will be administered as a 30-minute intravenous infusion. Following the initial administration, abatacept will be given at 2 and 4 weeks after the first infusion and every 4 weeks thereafter for up to 2 years.

Abatacept will be administered as a 30-minute intravenous infusion. Following the initial administration, abatacept will be given at 2 and 4 weeks after the first infusion and every 4 weeks thereafter for up to 2 years.

measure.title: Ocular Inflammation
measure.description: Ocular inflammation present at baseline, judged by fluorescein angiography, vitreous haze, and/or anterior chamber inflammation.

outcome.title: Adverse Events
outcome.description: number of participants with adverse events
outcome.population: 2 subjects were randomized to the 5 mg/kg abatacept group but one of these subjects only received 1 treatment before being removed from the study due to worsening. Only 1 of the 2 subjects randomized to this group completed the study. This explains the discrepancy between this table and the participant flow.

group.title: Randomized 10 mg/kg Abatacept
group.description: Abatacept: Subjects will receive approximately 10 mg/kg rounded to the nearest 25 mg for the first 6 months of the trial. At 6 months subjects will then continue receiving 10 mg/kg. Abatacept will be administered as a 30-minute intravenous infusion. Following the initial administration, abatacept will be given at 2 and 4 weeks after the first infusion and every 4 weeks thereafter for up to 2 years.

group.title: Randomized 5 mg/kg Abatacept
group.description: Abatacept: Subjects will receive approximately 10 mg/kg rounded to the nearest 25 mg for the first 6 months of the trial. At 6 months subjects will then receive 5 mg/kg. Abatacept will be administered as a 30-minute intravenous infusion. Following the initial administration, abatacept will be given at 2 and 4 weeks after the first infusion and every 4 weeks thereafter for up to 2 years.

group.title: Open Label Abatacept
group.description: All subjects received open label 10mg/kg abatacept during the first 24 weeks of the trial.

measure.title: Adverse Events
measure.description: number of participants with adverse events
measure.population: 2 subjects were randomized to the 5 mg/kg abatacept group but one of these subjects only received 1 treatment before being removed from the study due to worsening. Only 1 of the 2 subjects randomized to this group completed the study. This explains the discrepancy between this table and the participant flow.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Improvement by 2 or More Lines of Best-corrected Visual Acuity
outcome.description: improvement by 2 or more lines of best-corrected visual acuity With the outcome measure being at 24 weeks, only one group is analyzed. All the subjects received open-label abatacept at 10 mg/kg during the first 24 weeks.
outcome.population: All subjects started the trial on open label abatacept, so only one group is being analyzed for this 24 week outcome.

group.title: Open-label Abatacept

Following the initial administration, abatacept will be given at 2 and 4 weeks after the first infusion and every 4 weeks thereafter for up to 2 years.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
